reviewText: I think it is a great idea to take many directors and ask to bring their story about the Israeli way of life. As opposed to Israeli Moments, in "I have a dream", the filmmakers invite the viewer to enter their dreams, on the sensory experiential level, to dive into visions of personal and universal scope, and through them to connect to some sort of utopia.

After the first one: Israeli Moments, This time, they set for themselves a goal to move beyond the borders of reality and despair and to focus on the possibilities of what might be. Well, they succeed. Very Inspirational movie.
